content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expressions to match Question and Answer headers
    question_re = r"^# Question\s*$"m
    answer_re = r"^# Answer\s*$"m
    
    # Initialize result tuple
    result = Tuple{String, String}()
    
    # Loop over the lines of the markdown text
    for line in eachline(md)
        # If a line matches the Question header, save it as the question
        if occursin(question_re, line)
            question = ""
            while !occursin(answer_re, nextline(md)) && !isempty(nextline(md))
                question *= strip(readline(md))
            end
            # Add the question to the result
            push!(result, question)
        # If a line matches the Answer header, save it as the answer
        elseif occursin(answer_re, line)
            answer = ""
            while !occursin(question_re, nextline(md)) && !isempty(nextline(md))
                answer *= strip(readline(md))
            end
            # Add the answer to the result
            push!(result, answer)
        end
    end
    
    return result
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to match the `# Question` and `# Answer` headers in the markdown text. It then strips leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text before returning a tuple of the question and answer sections.
